bio: Alexandre is Android developer for more than 5 years. He passionate about Kotlin, MotionLayout and Framework created by Google. His current goal is to craft more intuitive and more usable applications. In addition, Alexandre enjoys to share his knowledge to the Android community. Currently working for Xebia in Paris.

sessions.name: Make some move with MotionLayout

bio: Lead Android Engineer at Lalafo. More than 6 years working with mobile. Have experience of scaling apps from several thousand to millions of users. Passionate about mobile and technology as well as about giving back to the community.

sessions.name: How to build a messenger for Android?

bio:
I help Android Developers boost their career and grow their personal branding.

Mentor and Kotlin Trainer Certified by JetBrains, writer of the book "Kotlin for Android Developers"

sessions.name: Back to the basics - You don't need to know it all

bio: Google Developer Expert for Android, Senior Engineer at Immobilienscout24, Kotlin enthusiast, Flutter amateur, Digital policy advocate, musing over British Tea and Salt & Vinegar crisps

sessions.name: Implementing the Paging Library
RxJava & Coroutines: A Practical Analysis

bio: With a couple of small personal projects under his belt, Attila entered the industry with an internship at Halcyon Mobile. During his years of experience in building digital products for startups and brands, Attila’s love for Android grew bigger than his appetite for the desserts its OSs are named after. Since good things are best when shared, Attila mentors young devs, introduces undergraduates to the wonders of software development and has conquered a stage at Droidcon Berlin & London too. Recently joined the Babylon Health in London.

sessions.name: Tensor Flow for Android Devs

bio: Brian has been passionate about making Android applications amazing for almost 9 years. He started his Android career working for TouchLab, then The New York Times, followed by Nike's s23NYC innovation lab, and is currently at Kiva. Brian is the co-founder of FriendlyRobot.nyc, an Android development shop in New York City. He enjoys speaking about Android at conferences and meetups. He also enjoys reading about astronomy, sleeping in the woods, tending to his plant herd, and flipping logs to find critters.
tagLine: Cofounder of FriendlyRobot, Senior Android Dev at Kiva

sessions.name: Getting the most out of code review

bio: Android team lead at WIT Software, he can easily be spotted there working on the company RCS solution. An enthusiastic for new technology and always trying to reach those last 20% of all of his side projects that seem to be really far away, he loves to share his knowledge with others either by giving talks, teaching, writing or along with a cold beer in the nearest pub. GDG Coimbra organizer and Kotlin evangelist, he also has a huge passion for travel, photography, space and the occasional run.
tagLine: Lead Software Engineer at WIT Software

sessions.name: The Hitchhikers Guide Through Kotlin Multiplatform

bio: Sr. Android Engineer living in Berlin. Working with Android since Gingerbread.

sessions.name: Navigation in Modular Applications with Deep Linking

bio:
One of the authors of Fotoapparat library for Android.
Currently trying to make the world better at Uber. Before that worked on car2go and Scanbot applications.

sessions.name: MyTextUtils or how to lose your business in 1 line
RIBs - Fragments which actually work

bio:
Dmytro is a Senior Software Engineer at Freeletics with an eye for pragmatism.  Keep the code clean, constantly improving it and mentoring other engineers are just some of his daily tasks. 
He loves open-source, hackathons and public speaking.
In his free time, he swims and explores the practical applications of machine learning.

sessions.name: Best of sign in experience

bio: Elaine has been working with mobile apps development for the past 6 years. Since the launch of the Google Assistant, she has been following the developments around that area. She truly believes that interacting with technology using natural language will define the future of computing. Born and raised in Brazil, she's been living in France since 2004 and loves everything multicultural. She's a GDE for the Google Assistant.

sessions.name: Building Voice-First Android Apps
The Flutter Journey From a Personal App to a Successful Production App

bio: After several years working like a mobile consultant, Enrico moved to London working as lead developer @Smartfocus.com developing an indoor positioning system based on beacons. Since May 2017 working @ TUI.co.uk where he's creating the next generation of mobile travel app for TUI customers.

sessions.name: Nitrogen in your (test) pyramid.

bio:
Evelio has been building mobile apps since 2007 on five different platforms. He currently works as an Engineering Manager on multiple WhatsApp teams at Facebook. He previously worked at Snapchat, Lyft, and other startups leading their mobile efforts. He has been speaking at mobile conferences since 2013. 

Talk to him about open source, modern languages, video games,  fútbol, traveling and design. 

https://evel.io | @eveliotc

sessions.name: Shrinking WhatsApp

bio: Fábio Carballo is one of the Android developers at the mobile bank N26, currently focusing in delivering a smooth and quality banking experience. After a nice experience in a smaller company, he understood that he wanted a challenge where he could learn on to scale a team as well as its development processes. He has a special love for those who care about improving the user experience with well grounded user research and smart interactions.

sessions.name: Tackling Android Development at Scale

bio:
Ishan is a passionate product enthusiast and self-taught developer who loves open source technologies, tech conferences, and hackathons.

Currently working as a Senior Android Engineer at Getaround (Amsterdam, Netherlands) before that he spent 2 years crafting experiments for Booking.com on their Android Apps. 

He is also PMC member at Apache Fineract Project and a Maintainer at Mifos Initiative. He successfully graduated as a Google Summer of Code Intern in 2014 under Mifos and in 2015 under XMPP Standards Foundation and has been mentoring students at Google Summer of Code ever since.

sessions.name: Roasting Google APIs on a Firebase to Create Uberritos

bio: Mobile developer for about 8 years with big experience on iOS and Android internals and network protocols communication

sessions.name: NDK First Steps

bio: Android Developer since 4.0.3, always wanted to become a speaker. Always seeking knowledge (and new challenges) and want to share what I learn with others. Shared knowledge is the best knowledge. Recently moved in London. Love reading books, blog posts, documentation.

sessions.name: MVI with Jetpack Compose

bio: Manuel is an Android Developer in the Developer Relations team at Google where he works to help other developers succeed.

sessions.name: Structured Concurrency: Asynchronous shift in Kotlin
What's Q in Android UI

bio: I am a passionate of mobile app development and IT security, and I've been lucky enough to combine both of them in my daily job for the past 6 years. Currently I am working at Build38, where we develop tools that enable mobile app developers to build their dream apps in a secure manner.

sessions.name: Introduction to Android app security

bio: I am Marcelo a Brazilian who lives in Lisbon. I love surfing and drinking craft beer. I've been a software engineer for more than 10 years with focus on mobile development.

sessions.name: Android Testing Strategy

bio: Android Software Architect at Babylon health, previously at Just Eat. Still searching for mobile architecture nirvana. Massive fan of reactive patterns and Kotlin. Has been recently dabbling in some functional programming concepts. Looking forward to teaching his daughter programming once she's old enough. Boardgamer and motorcyclist.
tagLine: Android Software Architect at Babylon Health

sessions.name: Bye bye RxJava: Building flexible SDKs with Kotlin and Coroutines

bio:
Nicola Corti has been an Android Software Engineer since 2.2, and a Free and Open Source lover for as long as he remembers. He’s currently working as an Android Engineer at Yelp Inc, connecting millions of users with great local businesses worldwide.

Nicola usually calls himself a 'community addict’. He can't survive without learning every day, sharing knowledge, and having fun with other developers. He’s also currently managing the GDG chapter in Pisa.

In his free time, he also loves photography, hiking, and cake design.

sessions.name: I have no idea what my app is doing ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

bio: CTO in a stealth mode FinTech based the Dominican Republic, mobile app developer since 2009 and 100% focused in Android since 2011, extensive experience in the area of research and development to meet needs for emerging markets(Africa and Latin America). Over 10 years of experience as a developer; passionate about in any type of activity related with education especially those that help other developers grow or to get people into software development; likes to serve as a mentor/coach, if you have anything in mind send me a message @noeBranagan.

sessions.name: Learning How to Learn Kotlin

bio: Pedro Veloso currently works at Audible, an Amazon subsidiary in New York as a mobile engineer. He previously worked in various startups and across different business domains, namely Hole 19 and Leya while in Portugal. He has been dealing with Android since the early days of the OS, and has had an active role in helping shape the community for mobile development in Portugal, he was a previous Lisbon's GDG member and one of the administrators at the community website androidPT.com .

sessions.name: Next generation Android UI with Jetpack Compose

bio: Philipp is the Android Tech Lead at mySugr in Vienna. He drives improving the development process of the Android team. He started splitting up the app into multiple modules, improved the build speed, moved the CI from Jenkins to CircleCI, introduced several Github checks for unit tests, integration tests with Firebase Test Lab, code styles and code smells.

sessions.name: Faster builds on Android - from 2 minutes to 2 seconds
Refactoring Risky Code

bio: In the Android Developer Relations team Pietro’s focus is to provide an awesome developer experience around Play technologies like Android Vitals and Android App Bundles.

sessions.name: Play Core library: Take control of Android App Bundles’ dynamic delivery

bio: Praveen has been working on SwiftKey Android for the last 2 years contributing to improving internal tooling for measuring keyboard performance, reducing the app size and most recently, building an OpenGL rendering engine for Microsoft SwiftKey Puppets

sessions.name: App size reduction at Microsoft SwiftKey

bio: Richard Süselbeck is a Principal Developer Evangelist for HERE Technologies, the world's leading location technology company. With over a decade of experience in teaching and training developers, he travels the globe to help them build the world of tomorrow using the HERE Location APIs. Richard has a PhD in Information Systems and lives in Berlin with his wife and no dogs.
tagLine: Principal Developer Evangelist for HERE Technologies

sessions.name: Where the Heck Am I? Understanding Location in Your Application

bio: Rick is a Senior Android developer at Milwaukee Tool. His primary focus is application architecture, with some dabbling in Bluetooth and coroutines.  He's a strong believer in clean, testable code with minimal boilerplate.
tagLine: Senior Android Developer at Milwaukee Tool

sessions.name: Coroutine-first Android architecture
Getting big payouts with Koin

bio:
I am a non-caffeine-addicted developer, MSc in Video Game Development working as a mobile developer at ShareChat, Bangalore India. My past industry experience of around four and a half years majorly incorporates mobile development on both Android and iOS platforms, native as well as cross-platform (Xamarin) development and video game development. I am passionate about animations. 

I have a special interest in playing and developing video games. Counter-Strike is still at the top of my favourite games list. Apart from video games, I love swimming and trekking. I won 1 gold and 4 silver medals in swimming at the KVS national level and 12 gold medals at the regional level and was awarded by the district collector for the same on 26th Jan 2006. I even attended 3 national level trekking camps in different regions of the Himalayan range. My life is extremely exciting with adventurous sports. In the year 2017, I drove the bike at the world's highest motorable road and made a bike trip to 'Leh, Kashmir'. I jumped from a height of 83 meters static platform with just a rope tied on my legs, Bunjee jump. I dived approx 25 meters below the water with an oxygen cylinder at my back, Scuba diving. I jumped from a height of approx 10,000 feet from Cessna 172 plane with an instructor and parachute on my back, Sky diving.

sessions.name: Cut your APK size with features on demand

bio: Thomas is an Android Engineer. For the past 4 years he has been in Lyft’s Growth team. He is currently based in Seattle, WA.

sessions.name: Experimentation at scale: fuel your application’s growth through A/B testing

bio: Xiaoyi is an Android engineer working at Dashlane with years of experience. He is focusing on building the best password manager, providing the most smooth UX and the best security solution for millions of users.

sessions.name: Secure Derivation of Passwords in Android

bio:
Zhenlei is an Android engineer at N26 developing the first mobile bank app in Europe. He was previously part of the team at Venturus in Brazil, where he also got the chance to work with various partners (Sony Mobile, Motorola, etc) on their Android projects.

He has not only been developing for Android since Gingerbread but he also contributed to the AOSP (Android Open Source Project) in the Android Framework UI/UX team. He has also experience developing prototypes (e.g. sleep detection using only mobile sensor) and test automation.

Besides that, he is origami enthusiast that tries to fold some piece of paper in his spare time.
tagLine: Android Engineer • Script Addicted • Origami Enthusiast

sessions.name: Life is too short not to use ADB commands
